@Wickity Thanks for digging through! I'm working on a more solid release hopefully soon.
@Wickity https://t.co/R4o0nXVD6v should work now (tested with latest Node on Mac OS). Sorry if it's a little rough ;)
@Wickity Ah yes, that branch might be a little tricky to get running (the UI was linked locally). I'll try and get it working this weekend.

@captainsafia Looks like it has all the content though, just missing the frontpage and final graphic colours.
@captainsafia Looks like I didn't push the final final version. Have to look through my archives and see if I can find it again.
@captainsafia @feathersjs Made it public at https://t.co/muj4zZkjv1. The out/ folder has a PDF version.
@captainsafia @feathersjs It is in German but I can make it available. We tried to have all the important info in the docs, too.
@_benstr @joshowens @thespacedojo @ekryski @feathersjs I'm honestly surprised. Let's hope we don't disappoint ;)
This was great! Thanks again for having us :) https://t.co/p6Y56mNq9B
@filesofnerds Thanks for the share. I just realized that I probably should update the code to version 2 :)
@sbellware @ekryski Sounds good. Is Google Hangouts ok? We are on mountain and pacific time.
@sbellware Care to elaborate outside of 140 characters? I wrote my thesis on SOA in 2010 and Feathers is basically a distilled version of it
@bredeleca @yycjs @ekryski We were just spoiled by @assemblycs ;)
